data.event: Hamilton became a municipality on 11 December 1871 and was named in honour of Edward Terrick Hamilton, who was then Governor of the board of directors of the Australian Agricultural Company (AA Co), from August 1857 to September 1898.
A borehole was sunk and a shaft was completed in 1849 and was known as the D Pit, or borehole.

data.event: Pittown grew up somewhere in the vicinity of todayâ€™s Beaumont street to service the needs of the miners and their families.
